title: Comparative Increase of White and Black Population in Georgia.

yaml.title: Comparative Increase of White and Black Population in Georgia.

markdown.markdown:
This plate shows the comparative increase of the white and black population of Georgia. It is interesting in that it is quite a simple time series, but the time axis is shown on the y-axis rather than the more typical x-axis. To recreate the spirit of this visualisation, I created plots for each row which showed a dot for each of the two races shown in DuBois' original graph. When viewed as a whole, the image of the original plate is revealed. This was one of the easiest panels to translate to `{gt}`. In place of a legend, I added the unicode characters for a filled and empty bullet to the column labels. ::: {.panel-tabset} # Table ```{r, ref.label=c('georgiaPopCode')} #| label: georgiaPopTbl #| echo: false ``` # Original ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ajstarks/dubois-data-portraits/master/challenge/challenge01/original-plate-07.jpg) # Code ```{r} #| label: georgiaPopCode #| eval: false library(tidyverse) library(gt) georgia_pop <- readr::read_csv( 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2021/2021-02-16/georgia_pop.csv' ) |> arrange(desc(Year)) |> rename(Black = Colored) plot_dots <- function(data) { labs <- tibble(y = rep("", 3), x = c(0, 50, 100)) plt <- data |> ggplot(aes(y = "")) + geom_vline(xintercept = seq(0, 100, 10), color = "red") + theme_void() + expand_limits(x = c(0, 100)) + scale_x_reverse() if (data$Year %in% c(1790, 1890)) { plt <- plt + geom_text( inherit.aes = FALSE, data = labs, aes(x, y, label = x), size = 27.5 ) } plt + geom_point(aes(x = Black), size = 35) + geom_point( aes(x = White), fill = "white", stroke = 4, shape = 21, size = 35 ) } plots <- georgia_pop |> group_split(Year) |> map(plot_dots) georgia_pop |> mutate(dots = NA) |> gt() |> gtExtras::gt_theme_538() |> fmt_percent(Black:White, scale_values = F, decimals = 0) |> tab_header(toupper("Comparative Increase of White and Black Population in Georgia.")) |> tab_options(data_row.padding = 0, heading.align = "center") |> cols_width(dots ~ px(250), Year:White ~ px(80)) |> cols_label( dots = "", Black = html("
